result.execSummary:
The defendant Daroyl C Lee was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Maintain Drug Trafficking Place, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.42(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant is to provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay the related surcharge and pay Court costs and victim/ witness surcharges;  to be collected by the DOC from up to 25%  of prison funds with balance to be paid by 07-02-21.  
Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment.

SENTENCE TO BE SERVED IN THE WISCONSIN STATE PRISON.
Consecutive to: to any other sentence, Straight Time.

Defendant advised that as a convicted felon, he may no longer use or possess any firearms and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Restitution is set at $0.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Daroyl C Lee in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

  The Court ordered the Defendant to:
-Serve 6 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 5 days time served.  STRAIGHT TIME. Sentence to be served in the Wisconsin State Prison.
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 7/2/2021; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge  to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 7/2/2021; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
-Restitution set at zero
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Justice Point Reort received and filed. sab

Defendant Daroyl C Lee in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent. Nick Cerwin for Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
  Defendant  advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.   Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms; also defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Case calendared for SENTENCING on 7/2/2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.
Justice Point Report received and filed. sab

Defendant Daroyl C Lee in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requests one more Final pretrial conference.    Court ordered case adjourned for final pre-trial conference in Branch 15.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Received and filed.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Justice Point Violation Report received and filed. Matter was reviewed. sab

Defendant Daroyl C Lee in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk:  ss

Information previously filed.  Defense waived the reading and entered a not guilty plea.  Defense motion to sever this case with the co-defendant case 15CF887 is granted by the court.  

Defense request for a final pretrial date and a jury trial date is granted by the court.  Scheduling order signed and filed.    Court ordered case adjourned for final pre-trial conference in Branch 15  Final pre-trial scheduled for 05-21-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Daroyl C Lee in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Ron Dague for Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Keith Kopcha-MPD Detective. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading.  Case is adjourned to Branch 15.  Arraignment scheduled for March 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 3/3/15.
css

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Co-Defendant Davell Young.

Defendant Daroyl C Lee in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Daroyl C Lee in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
